description:
I can kill it, start over, and then it usually works.

It seems to be busy-waiting on something . strace shows a bunch of threads waiting on futexes and a single one calling epoll_wait a *lot*. I'm attaching the last 1000 lines of run_tests_log.
title: Tests hang frequently in XenAPIVMTestCase.test_parallel_builds

comments.content:

It seems to be busy-waiting on something . strace shows a bunch of threads waiting on futexes and a single one calling epoll_wait a *lot*. I'm attaching the last 1000 lines of run_tests_log.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~soren

comments.content:
Seems to me that this is when the test should be failing, however it doesn't assert anything and just hangs instead. Perhaps just add a timeout where it's calling .wait() and fail if it doesn't in time? Seems risky to me, and that also means we need to make it work.

I say nuke the test!
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~alex-meade

comments.content: Adding eventlet.monkey_patch() to the top of the test file seemed to squash this for me, but I'm hesitant to say definitively because it's not consistently reproducible.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~blamar

comments.content: Nevermind, I was just getting lucky.
